Company Description

Credsoft Technologies is a company that specializes in website development, mobile applications, e-commerce, custom software development, and much more. They work closely with clients to understand their unique needs and create solutions that set them apart from the competition. They have expertise in PHP, Laravel, React Js, Node Js, Shopify, WordPress, Flutter, Kotlin, IOS, Swift, and more. Their end-to-end services ensure projects are delivered on time and on budget, and they aim to transform businesses' digital presence.

Role Description

This is a remote internship role for someone looking to gain experience in Business Development. The Business Development Intern will be responsible for lead generation, market research, customer service, and communication with clients. The intern will also be expected to use analytical skills to analyze industry trends and data.

Qualifications
• Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• Ability to generate leads and perform market research
• Understanding of customer service basics, with a desire to provide quality service
• Experience with social media platforms and developing promotional strategies
• Ability to work independently and remotely
• Experience with sales or business development preferred
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field preferred

Qualifications: Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to generate leads and perform market research
Understanding of customer service basics, with a desire to provide quality service
Experience with social media platforms and developing promotional strategies
Ability to work independently and remotely

The intern will also be expected to use analytical skills to analyze industry trends and data

This is a full-time internship position for our Summer Rotation, expected to start March 18, 2024 through September 13, 2024 in Mountain View, CA.

The intern will be responsible for independently handling assigned projects, including but not limited to a wide variety of administrative tasks, conducting surveys, and managing presentations on various topics relevant to the BMW Technology Office. Furthermore, introduction to HR related topics such as managing all interns at the Tech Office as well as helping with onboarding of full-time employees. Fleet management will round out the experience. The cooperation with all engineers on project related purchasing tasks allows for insights in Tech Office projects.

data.job_title: Business Marketing Co-op - (Fall 2024 Semester - August Start)_
data.job_description: **What to Expect in our Co-op Program:**Expand your technical and professional skills in a real-world setting. Copeland co-ops are given meaningful work, support, and mentorship from experienced managers and key business leaders. There is the potential to gain knowledge and experience in a variety of ways by exploring opportunities associated with your major and rotating through multiple departments.**What We Offer:**Competitive compensation, flexible dress code policy, and paid holidaysHousing stipends for eligible students and a list of nearby housing options for relocationAccess to our newly renovated fitness center, workout classes, and wellness programEvent opportunities through our social and professional development co-op committeesOur co-ops are a key talent pipeline for full-time employment opportunities after graduation at our many locations.If you are a **Business** **Marketing Student** looking for an opportunity to grow, Copeland has an exciting opportunity for you! Based in our **Sidney, Ohio** location, you will have the opportunity to support different groups within Copeland. You will work with Sales and Marketing teams to support not only their managers, but aftermarket customers, customer relationship management, and department marketing activities related to research and product launches as well. Your responsibilities may involve cross-functional team interactions with professional members of Product Management, Application Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and the Global Service Center.**AS A BUSINESS MARKETING CO-OP, YOU WILL:**+ Conduct market research and surveys+ Create reports, analyze data, and interpret results for management+ Assist in developing, evaluating, implementing, updating and maintaining various department websites, tools, programs and processes+ Support event management (trade shows, webinars, etc.)+ Attend and participate in meetings and carry out designated action items+ Support projects and manage time for multiple assignments**WHO YOU ARE:**You try different solutions for problems and learn from the results. You stay aligned with your goals and stay productive. You focus on creating an effective collaborative style. You prepare content for communication that is impactful.**REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:**+ Undergraduate student currently pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field+ Ability to work 40 hours per week during the scheduled semester+ Legal authorization to work in the United States - Sponsorship for this role will not be provided**PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:**+ Undergraduate student pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Analytics, or Engineering with a Business Interest/Minor+ Cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher+ Sophomore or higher class status preferred+ Strong oral and written communications skills, analytical and decision-making skills, and PC skills including Microsoft Office+ Strong project and data organization skills+ Strong attention to detail+ Have the ability to work in a team setting and ability to utilize other web-based programs (i.e.: surveys, internal communication sites, etc.)+ Reliable transportation- Sidney has multiple locations and will need own transportation for commuting**Benefits**Copeland places a high value on ensuring that employees have a good work-life balance. We provide access to a competitive benefits package, including the following: medical insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401k participation with a competitive match, fitness center, holiday pay and an online wellness rewards program. Employee resource groups, including a very active Diversity and Inclusion committee, ensure that the Copeland values are incorporated into everyday employee life.**Why Work in the Greater Miami Valley Area**Our facility is located in Sidney, OH (idneyoh.com/31/Visitors) which is conveniently located within driving distance to several larger cities, such as Dayton (aytonlocal.com/events.asp) , Troy (royohio.gov/) , and Columbus. (xperiencecolumbus.com/events/) The area’s generally low costs of living, excellent school systems, and low crime rates create a family-friendly environment. The area is home to several growing communities with restaurants, festivals, shopping, and arts scenes that make them exciting places to live and work.**About our Location**The newly renovated Sidney campus has 1M square feet of manufacturing floor with an additional 120k square feet of leading-edge lab facilities. This location is the headquarters for the air conditioning and cold chain businesses. Through our 30 years of scroll compressor expertise, our air conditioning related products help bring comfort and convenience in commercial, industrial and residential spaces. The cold chain business helps ensure that food safely and efficiently travels from farm to fork. Approximately 1600 employees work in Sidney, who all support a multitude of business functions. With the blend of businesses and functions represented under this one roof, there are many opportunities for advancement within the Sidney location.**Our Commitment to Our People**Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: Sustainability is no small ambition. That’s why everything we do is geared toward a sustainable future—for our generation and all those to come. Through groundbreaking innovations, HVACR technology and cold chain solutions, we are reducing carbon emissions and improving energy efficiency in spaces of all sizes, from residential to commercial to industrial.Our employees are our greatest strength. We believe that our culture of passion, openness, and collaboration empowers us to work toward the same goal - to make the world a better place. We invest in the end-to-end development of our people, beginning at onboarding and through senior leadership, so they can thrive personally and professionally.Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and more. We provide employees with flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.Together, we have the opportunity – and the power – to continue to revolutionize the technology behind air conditioning, heating and refrigeration, and cultivate a better future. Learn more about us and how you can join our team!**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**At Copeland, we believe having a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment is critical to our success. We are committed to creating a culture where every employee feels welcomed, heard, respected, and valued for their experiences, ideas, perspectives and expertise. Ultimately, our diverse and inclusive culture is the key to driving industry-leading innovation, better serving our customers and making a positive impact in the communities where we live.**Work Authorization**Copeland will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1 with OPT or CPT, H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.**Equal Opportunity Employer**Copeland is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.**About Copeland**We are a global climate technologies company engineered for sustainability. We create sustainable and efficient residential, commercial and industrial spaces through HVACR technologies. We protect temperature-sensitive goods throughout the cold chain. And we bring comfort to people globally. Best-in-class engineering, design and manufacturing combined with category-leading brands in compression, controls, software and monitoring solutions result in next-generation climate technology that is built for the needs of the world ahead.Whether you are a professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring your first opportunity, or recent graduate with an advanced degree, we have opportunities that will allow you to innovate, be challenged and make an impact. Join our team and start your journey today!**No calls or agency requests please.**

Exciting opportunity for college student(s) who can join us in person at our headquarters office in Durham a few days a week!

Background:

WorkSmart is an industry leading MSP company delivering $20M of IT services to its customers each year. We are launching our first ever intern program to support our company's new directive to grow our sales funnel. This is a highly dynamic time for our company, so an intern can expect to earn more responsibility through the course of their internship and if does well may receive a full-time offer.

Looking to hire interns who:
• Have strong work ethic and ownership
• Flexibility with structured/unstructured work
• Are students in the Raleigh/Durham area
• Comfortable making 50 phone calls a day facing a high percentage of rejection and objections
• Preferred but not required: sales experience, business acumen, passion for technology, and experience with primary market research

Internship Responsibilities:
• Collect market research data by calling and surveying small businesses in NC to understand current satisfaction or dissatisfaction with their in-house IT or their existing Managed IT Services Provider
• Help team understand and identify market opportunities and accounts to prioritize
• Assist in creating and maintaining database of potential customers

Opportunities to:
• Assist our aggressive revenue growth plan, pilot the internship program, and identify other potential room for generating leads and qualified opportunities for the sales team
• Potentially continue growing with our company in a Business Development Rep or related position after successful internship completion

Details:
• 10 hours a week during spring semester; 20-40 hours a week during summer
• $15/ hour pay with incentive bonus compensation based on performance
• Internship is in person at company office in Durham, NC

How the Process Works:
• Apply online
• You can expect to hear back from me (Hi, I'm Brett by the way) within 24hrs
• If initial application goes well, we have a candidate exercise to further test your abilities
• If exercise is completed to standards, we will go to interviews so the team can meet you and vice versa and decide if we think we'd all be a good fit

Qualifications: Have strong work ethic and ownership
Flexibility with structured/unstructured work
Responsibilities: Collect market research data by calling and surveying small businesses in NC to understand current satisfaction or dissatisfaction with their in-house IT or their existing Managed IT Services Provider
Help team understand and identify market opportunities and accounts to prioritize
Assist in creating and maintaining database of potential customers
Benefits: Assist our aggressive revenue growth plan, pilot the internship program, and identify other potential room for generating leads and qualified opportunities for the sales team
$15/ hour pay with incentive bonus compensation based on performance

data.job_description:
Business Development Representative Intern

Summer 2024 - Remote Internship

At Reltio, we aim to help enterprises improve efficiency, manage risk and drive growth, which is particularly critical in today's challenging and dynamic environment. Our customers historically have turned to Reltio for master data management (MDM) solutions to address their needs - however, we provide more than MDM. We provide broader capabilities to transform siloed data from disparate sources into unified, trusted, interoperable data. We have developed our new corporate positioning narrative to reflect this. As a company, we are evolving to expand beyond Master Data Management (MDM) - to Data Unification & Management. Our objectives are to unlock market share and value beyond (and within) the core traditional MDM market.

Reltio’s values:
• Customer First
• Better Together
• Simplify & Share
• Own It
• Always Better Than Yesterday

Internship Summary:
• 10 week internship program commitment
• Meet with the CEO to learn about Reltio's story to success and growth.
• Participate in learning sessions from leaders around the company to learn about how Reltio operates and gain useful skills to take with you in your career.
• Participate in intern cohort meetings with the other interns in the company to collaborate and build relationships.
• Research, target, and identify key contacts and personas in our target market.
• Validate contact information and key contacts within an organization
• Collaborate with team to progress leads, prospects, and opportunities through the sales process
• Complete final internship project

What You Bring to the Team:
• Interest in planning and managing projects or marketing/sales programs.
• A strong desire to be in a fast-paced, team-oriented sales and marketing environment.
• An energetic and engaging personality
• Attention to detail
• Excellent organization, time management, and communication skills to take initiative and work proactively with minimal supervision
• An entrepreneurial spirit, passionate about what you do, enthusiastic, competitive, disciplined, collaborative, self-motivated with a strong work ethic
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Ability to take direction, be coached and mentored
• College Sophomore, Junior or Senior with concentration Business
• Strong web and computer skills preferred

Benefits:
• Ability to work from home
• Flexibility
• Transparent, meritocratic, and leadership culture
• Unlimited access to the best technology

At Reltio, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.

Overall Market Range

$20—$25 USD

Reltio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Reltio is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

Qualifications: Interest in planning and managing projects or marketing/sales programs
A strong desire to be in a fast-paced, team-oriented sales and marketing environment
An energetic and engaging personality

College Sophomore, Junior or Senior with concentration Business

data.job_description:
About the opportunity:

SWCA is seeking a Business Application Analyst Intern to join the Solution Development Team in the Summer of 2024. We offer a challenging work environment where you will be a part of a team developing systems in support of SWCA’s scientific and business needs. SWCA offers an enthusiastic, supportive, and casual work environment with flexible schedules. This position is available to sit remote in any location within the United States.

This internship will occur during the summer of 2024 (June 3rd-mid August). Candidates who can start earlier than June 2024 will be considered, and those who can remain past August may provide additional value. Interns can expect coaching and direction from functional leadership in their respective support areas and participate in the larger internship cohort for scheduled developmental programming with senior organizational leaders.

This is a paid, full-time internship. Interns will be paid $17.00/hour based off the reporting office location for this role.

Please submit a cover letter to be considered for this position.

Applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as is reasonable. We anticipate a large flow of qualified candidates, and we will close the posting as soon as the individual office positions are filled.

Our Vision (the North Star): Help drive SWCA to be the best workplace and industry leader in sustainability, bringing sound science and creative solutions to global environmental challenges while maintaining a dedication to employee-ownership.

Core Values: We are #OneSWCA and collaborate across all our offices, programs, and disciplines. We are #AlwaysLearning, we #NeverSettle, and we #GiveBack. We are 100% employee-owned, and we build our success together. It is imperative for the successful candidate to fit SWCA's unique culture. Do you appreciate sustainability and environmental awareness? Is giving back to your community a priority? SWCA is a team of scientists, planners, technical experts, and corporate services professionals that are committed to our culture.

Purpose: Our company purpose is to preserve natural and cultural resources for tomorrow while enabling projects that benefit people today. You are invited to be a part of our success story.

What you will accomplish:
• Provide ongoing support of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) - Deltek Vision applications and processes to users
• Perform Deltek Vision administration and maintenance tasks, including testing and updates in accordance with SWCA's Change Management Policy
• Create, test, document, monitor and maintain SQL procedures
• Assist with the identification of internal user needs for enterprise applications and assist with implementing identified end user needs
• Perform technical troubleshooting and resolution
• Engage professionally and work collaboratively with our team and the business to understand and meet their needs.
• Research problems, plan solutions, assist with software and system recommendations, and coordinate development to meet business needs.
• Assist on technology projects, upgrades and enhancements and help with analysis tasks.
• Map and document business technology processes, offer suggestions and process improvements

Experience and qualifications for success:

Preferred:
• Experience creating and troubleshooting scripts in one or more languages, preferably SQL
• Experience troubleshooting issues and providing resolution, including database, script, and system review.
• Knowledge of and ability to learn requirements gathering and mapping and documenting processes.
• Experience working in MS Teams
• Experience with data visualization tools, ie: Visual Studio and Power BI
• Strong problem-solving skills and a strong desire for continued learning
• Excellent communication skills
• Ability to work independently and on a team

Required:
• Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program having a junior classification or higher, with an emphasis in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
• Recent graduates will also be considered with a graduation date within 12 months of May 2024. Applicants that are pursuing a Master's degree will also be considered. Ph.D. candidates are not eligible through this program.
• Ability to work as a member of a mostly remote team.
• Reliable high speed Internet connection required.

SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full-spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.

If you would like to contact SWCA regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the online application process due to a disability, please email accommodations@swca.com or call 1-480-581-5378. This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

EOE - women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply.

An exciting opportunity for ambitious recent graduates who want to fast-track their career in sales & marketing, and play an active role in propelling the growth journey of a rising martech company.

We're looking for highly independent, budding sales professionals who possess the knowledge and skills to generate their own leads, tackle challenging sales situations, artfully close deals and build meaningful client relationships.

An ideal role for those who want to build a career in e-commerce, fashion, food, hospitality, health & wellness, automotive, aviation, software, financial services or investment banking, as well as the luxury industry. Make valuable connections in these sectors - the professional network you build through XIRCLS will serve you your entire career!

Responsibilities:
• Thoroughly understand the product/s & pricing through reading, research and discussions with the team
• Identify & qualify leads. Cold call, email and pitch to marketing managers and founders
• Coordinate and follow-up with prospective clients over calls and virtual meetings
• Close deals, assist in onboarding clients, educate them about product features
• Work closely with the core team to ideate on new sales strategies & their implementation

Requirements:

● Past sales experience ideal

● Proven record/ or drive to meet or exceed sales targets

● Exceptional verbal / written communication and presentation skills

● Proactive and taking initiative

● Single-mindedly driven to achieve targets

Compensation Structure:

This is a commission-based role with no fixed compensation and flexible working hours. Our commissions are attractive and will be earned when the leads you generate convert to paying clients.

data.job_description: About OCC: A World Class Clearing Organization OCC is the largest equity derivatives clearing organization in the world. We provide central counterparty clearing and settlement services for equity options, futures, options on futures, and securities lending transactions. We serve approximately 115 clearing members and 15 exchanges including CBOE, Nasdaq, and NYSE. OCC is building a culture that empowers continued learning, authentic innovation, and constant creativity. About the Intern Program: OCC is looking for interns who are hungry for the chance to learn more, humble enough to admit they don’t know all the answers, and smart enough to recognize the opportunity. The OCC Internship Program provides students with the real-world skills to successfully transition into a career in the financial services industry. As an intern, you will help lead projects that help shape the future of OCC. This person will apply their skill set and knowledge toward tackling designated projects. This is an exciting opportunity to have a true impact on the company by designing and implementing solutions for real challenges facing the business. Here’s what we’re looking for: The intern will support department efforts to prepare for the transition from our current clearing system (ENCORE) to our future system (Ovation). Responsibilities may include creation of job aids and procedures, development of training materials, and participation in User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Engagement in this project will help the intern understand and appreciate the complexity of a large-scale project and gain experience across multiple workstreams. The intern will also contribute to strengthening the control environment through assisting in the preparation of audit evidence, executing controls related to basic processing, assistance with management self-testing, and contributing to the review of departmental controls and testing procedures. Candidate Qualifications: Familiarity with Microsoft Office applications An interest in the financial markets Intern will gain experience in: Familiarity with the role of Central Counterparty clearing and settlement within the US options marketplace. Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle and experience in supporting the transition to a new processing platform. Step 1 When you find a position you're interested in, click the 'Apply' button. Please complete the application and attach your resume. Step 2 You will receive an email notification to confirm that we've received your application. Step 3 If you are called in for an interview, a representative from OCC will contact you to set up a date, time, and location. For more information about OCC, please click here. OCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer What We Offer A highly collaborative and supportive environment developed to encourage work-life balance and employee wellness. Some of these components include: A hybrid work environment, up to 2 days per week of remote work Tuition Reimbursement to support your continued education Student Loan Repayment Assistance Technology Stipend allowing you to use the device of your choice to connect to our network while working remotely Generous PTO and Parental leave Competitive health benefits including medical, dental and vision OCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer OCC is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. OCC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, age, marital status, religion, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Numerous studies have shown that people from groups that are traditionally under-represented in financial services apply to jobs only if they believe they meet 100% of the requirements. We want to break down this mindset to further diversify our workforce. We encourage you to review our open positions and apply if you think your experience may be a match, even if you do not meet all of the qualifications. Your perspective may be an element we need to continue building innovative solutions to support the markets and market participants we serve. OCC is a globally recognized entity that clears a multitude of diverse and sophisticated products. We want to reflect this in the diversity of our workforce. If you need a disability related accommodation for any part of the application process, please email occtalentacquision@theoccc.com. The Options Clearing Corporation (OCC) is the world's largest equity derivatives clearing organization. Founded in 1973, OCC is dedicated to promoting stability and market integrity by delivering clearing and settlement services for options, futures and securities lending transactions. As a Systemically Important Financial Market Utility (SIFMU), OCC operates under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. OCC has more than 100 clearing members and provides central counterparty (CCP) clearing and settlement services to 19 exchanges and trading platforms. More information about OCC is available at www.theocc.com.

Soofa is the neighborhood news feed that connects a community with screens everyone can see and anyone can use. We're a woman-founded MIT startup with a mission to make cities smart, social, and sustainable.

We are seeking a current MBA or MPA/MPP student to work directly with our founder and VP of Business Development in launching new strategic partnerships and growth projects for the business. This is a unique opportunity to collaborate closely with the founder and envision new pathways for the company to scale exponentially.

Remote applicants (U.S.-based only) welcome. Candidates from underrepresented backgrounds are especially encouraged to apply.

Soofa is for people with a shared stake in a special place. Learn more about Soofa culture here.

data.job_description:
Description:

Overall Job Summary

Are you ready to launch your career in data, analytics, reporting and data science? Experience the various facets of data and analytics in our internship program!

As an Altair Business Analyst Intern you will be exposed to key areas of data, analytics and reporting. Working directly with our CEO, President of Analytics and VP of Sales, you will learn about real-life applications of business analytics including data hygiene, preparation and aggregation, problem-solving with data, exploratory analytics and building reports of your findings.

Program Highlights

Professional Development: As a small company, you will be exposed to many different tools and facets as a Business Analyst. We utilize Python, SQL, SSIS, Alteryx, SSRS, PowerBI and Tableau and you will gain valuable experience in some or all of these tools.

Key Projects: Our interns are given key responsibilities and meaningful projects to work on. These are fulfilling, important, deadline-driven projects to provide valuable real-world experience.

Mentorship: You will receive personalized guidance from mentors who will support your professional and personal growth, answer your questions and help you navigate the possibilities within your desired career path.

Full-time Pathway: Our program is designed to expose you to all facets of the data, analytics, reporting field with potential opportunities to grow into data science and predictive modeling positions. In addition to Business Analyst, we also regularly have open positions for Data Analysts, Developers, IT and Network Coordinators, Help Desk Analysts and Data Scientists.

The Business Analyst Intern understands and agrees to the following:
• This can be a part-time or full-time paid internship. Must be a minimum of 15 hours per week. We will work with your school requirements to make sure you receive course credit.
• This is an in-person position at the Altair offices in Brentwood, TN at 1749 Mallory Lane, Brentwood, TN 37027.
• This is a paid position to be negotiated based on experience

Roles & Responsibilities

This role is responsible for supporting all functional areas related to customer analytics. This role will use company and customer data to help identify opportunities, improve broader understanding, and answer business questions related to our customers.
• Become a functional expert in company and customer data, which includes but is not limited to defining data elements, providing input on data structure, creating & maintaining business reporting, and aiding in training documentation as needed.
• Work cross functionally with various stakeholders across the company to identify customer data needs and provide insights, analytics, dashboarding, or reporting support
• Identify business opportunities utilizing various company data elements (such as market trends, source data comparisons, and challenger/champion comparisons of similar data sources) cross shopping, frequency, basket, loyalty, and segmentation data)
• Monitor the business each week to uncover customer trends and proactively provide insights to various stakeholders
• Develop and interpret customer dashboards and findings to business leadership
• Troubleshoot dashboards and reporting through knowledge of the databases and toolset
• Training end users on new reports and dashboards

Requirements:

The ideal candidate would have an interest in US financial and macro-economic trends. We have access to data from all three major credit bureaus as well as a variety of other consumer and property datasets. The ideal candidate would have a basic understanding of the bigger picture of how these datasets intersect.

While in the program, you would learn how month-to-month changes in certain datapoints should guide or inform the company and our clients about changes in US financial trends and key consumer behaviors.

Required Qualifications

Experience: 1+ years experience working in a team environment.

Education: Working on a Bachelor’s Degree or higher from an accredited college or university in Business, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent experience. Any suitable combination of education and experience will be considered.

Preferred knowledge, skills or abilities
• Passion for data and analytics
• Have an interest in and basic understanding of US financial and macro-economic data
• Microsoft Office knowledge
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a strong emphasis on grammar
• Must be a self-starter, detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines
• Highly organized with ability to work independently as well as part of a team
• Exhibit integrity through fair and ethical behaviors in all activities; maintain accountability for performance
• Strong attention to detail with well-developed organizational and communication skills
• Eager to learn

The ideal candidate would have an interest in US financial and macro-economic trends
We have access to data from all three major credit bureaus as well as a variety of other consumer and property datasets
The ideal candidate would have a basic understanding of the bigger picture of how these datasets intersect

data.job_description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Job Summary Our 10–12-week program as an intern at Comcast will help you cultivate meaningful relationships, develop professional skills, gain insight to the day-to-day operations of a top media and technology company, and receive mentorship opportunities to expand your professional network. You will gain invaluable knowledge of our industry, be part of our diverse and welcoming culture and receive exposure to other areas of the business, all while working on real life business projects and functions. Comcast's Consumer Product Services organization focuses on evaluating new opportunities and value propositions for Xfinity across our product portfolio (Internet, Mobile, Video/Entertainment). Job Description Core Responsibilities Play a critical role in the development of the long-term product vision to grow our core businesses Define new product strategies to differentiate our residential products and continue to drive subscriber and profitable growth Research and identify emerging business models that could be used to accelerate our growth Work collaboratively with the organization to develop product strategies including technical options/benefits, consumer value propositions, go-to-market, business case and competitive response, translating strategies into product roadmaps for delivery Drive customer-centric thinking and best practices into these strategies and ensuring we're applying the right level of strategic rigor in decision making Regular, Consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Basic Requirements Proven ability to lead independently and develop an independent point of view, a bias for action, interest in tech/media and strong business acumen. Currently pursuing a Master of Business Administration degree from a United States-based college or university Returning to degree-program (for at least a semester) after the completion of the summer internship Preferred Major(s): Business Administration Available to work 40 hours per week over the course of the summer program Pay Grad MBA: $45/hr Compensation Base Pay: $45.00 Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details. The application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later. Education Certifications (if applicable) Relative Work Experience 0-2 Years Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. At Comcast , you have the power to connect the world. Your career options are endless as you grow in your career. Explore your future with access to a variety of teams, locations, and resources in an expanding network. You can also explore additional opportunities at our company, NBCUniversal.

data.job_title: Intern - Customer and Business Insights Analysis
data.job_description:
Acxiom’s Financial Services Strategy Team is seeking a highly analytical and curious Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team and help drive client success. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for performing deep-dive data analyses that uncover business trends and actionable insights to drive growth and optimization for clients across our diverse Financial Services portfolio. Working closely with sales and account management teams, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be involved in crafting customer value proposition, improving account growth, and enhancing presales strategies through data driven insights that demonstrate measurable impact. Using first party and qualitative data, the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will mine relevant insights that answer not only the “what” but the “why” and lead to better understanding of our client’s marketing programs and business. To succeed in this role, the ideal candidate will thrive in a growth rich environment and have a passion for bringing data to life with analytical storytelling and narratives. Demonstrating creative solutioning, logical reasoning, and excellent collaborative skills, while bringing a “can do” demeanor to the team. Internship Details:

This internship opportunity will begin May, 20th

2024 Our intention is to have interns work on-site in Conway, Arkansas 40 hours/week work dedication during summer and breaks, 20-29/week during the semester Anticipated graduation date between May 2025 - December 2025 Applicants for this internship position with Acxiom in the U.S. must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Acxiom (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (CPT/OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status) Key Responsibilities:Design, implement and socialize data analysis that support marketing and customer engagement strategies Integrate research and market data with customer data insights to drive understanding of emerging trends and anticipate changing account needs Identify important metrics and develop business intelligence/insights to better the understanding of customer data behaviors, trends and shifts across client accounts Support team with quantitative methods on identified business opportunities and generate insights to support pre-sales and account management objectives Collaborate with Analytical Center of Excellence on advance predictive modeling and machine learning strategies for clients Stay informed about, communicate, and apply new or current trends and standard processes in analytics Requirements:Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 5+years of experience in customer data analytics with a confirmed understanding of MarTech Experience in lending, credit or wealth management industry preferred Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze data sets, diagnose opportunities, and convert results into business value statements Curious critical thinker who can identify incremental impact, scalability, and repeatability beyond the task at hand Effective communicator with colleagues, management, and cross-functional collaborators Experience processing, extracting, and manipulating large data sets including first and third party data integration Experience with test design, data segmentation, and post campaign analysis Experience with direct marketing and/or digital media concepts Experience in unstructured, or root cause, analysis to accurately frame business problems as solvable analytics problems Experience in taking a consultative approach to problem solving Experience working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Strong advanced Excel and hands-one experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Looker Experience with statistical software like SQL, SAS, and/or R and Python Familiarity with cloud analytics capabilities, architectures and trends We believe in building an exciting workplace where associates feel highly motivated and want to engage every single day. It’s meaningful to Acxiom that we invest in our culture and promote a healthy work-life balance. Acxiom has a fast paced, high-performance workspace where we empower our people to do innovative, ground breaking work. You will always be guided to do what is right. Acxiom is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected. #GD17 #EarlyCareer Primary Location City/State: Homebased - Conway, Arkansas Additional Locations (if applicable): Acxiom is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, military status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics or other protected status. Attention California Applicants:

Please see our CCPA/CPRA Privacy Act notice here. Attention Colorado, California, Connecticut, Maryland, Nevada, New York City, Ohio, Rhode Island, and Washington Applicants: This position is not located in the aforementioned locations but applications for remote work may be considered. For information about this role under state or local equal pay or pay transparency laws, please contact recruit@acxiom.com.

Who We Are

Ampcontrol is a venture-backed startup. We are a team of engineers and energy experts building the new way of EV charging for fleets. A truly global company, Ampcontrol’s team and partners span five continents.

Ampcontrol works with fleet operators, solutions companies, and others to reduce energy costs, avoid late departures, and ensure reliable charging operations through AI-powered software.

data.job_title: University and Graduate Internships  – Business Support Functions 2024 (Italy)
data.job_description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Italy

"

Would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company?

Do you enjoy taking on challenging projects?

Join our innovating Internship Program

The Baker Hughes Internship is designed to enable recent graduates or undergraduates pursing a Bachelors or Masters degree (preferred) to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. Our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of leading-edge technology.

Partner with the best

Our internship will provide you with the opportunity to participate in technically focused training, team meetings and work on projects and present your results. During your internship you will be supported by a buddy and your manager who will ensure that you have a valuable learning experience.

As an Intern, you will be responsible for:
• Receiving coaching and mentoring to enable you to complete assignments and projects to develop your learning and skillset
• Completing internal projects to deliver customer outcomes and identify business improvements
• Learning internal software to assist with the completion of projects and tasks
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams and interns to interact and network with global business leaders
• Applying Health, Safety and Environment (HS&E) standards and procedures in all situations to ensure compliance is maintained

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:
• Be currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (preferred) in STEM, Arts or Business subjects
• Have maintained a GPA grade greater than or equal to 3.0 out of 4.0 or the equivalent in your country
• Be in your final or penultimate year of degree studies
• Be fluent in oral and written English
• Have the legal right to work without restrictions in the country you have applied

Business Support Services

There are a range of different internship assignments available in functions that support the business including Marketing, Commercial Operations, HR, Sales & Commercial, Project Management, Project Planning and Risk Analysis. Whatever the project you are assigned, you will get exposure to the engineering and manufacturing industry, which will give you a foundation to develop skills that can be used in your future career.

After completing this Internship you may have the opportunity to access to our early-career development program, designed to attract and retain students who are ready to help us deliver innovative outcomes to our customers (visit https://careers.bakerhughes.com/global/en/aspire to learn more)

Work in a way that works for you

We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In this role, we can confidently offer flexible working patterns (e.g. remote working). Talk to us about your desired working options when you apply!

Accessibility @ Baker Hughes sites in Italy

Should you have any special needs or disabilities, don’t hesitate to let us know in advance: we’ll set up appropriate arrangements or accommodation to offer you a comfortable and productive job interview.

Working with us

Working at Baker Hughes means being at the forefront of the energy transition. Our people are diverse, ambitious and collaborative. We’re on a mission to redefine the energy sector by unlocking the power of engineering, data and science.

About Us

With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, were committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and were always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.

Join us

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

data.job_description:
Overview

Hiring now for a Business Intern (Summer 2024)

This is an hourly non-exempt position at an hourly rate of $21.87.

The Mendocino Companies (Mendocino Forest Products Company, Mendocino Redwood Company, Humboldt Redwood Company, Humboldt Sawmill Company, and Allweather Wood), is a leading manufacturer and distributor of environmentally certified redwood, Douglas-fir, preservative treated, and fire retardant treated lumber products throughout California and the Western U.S.
Our culture is based on environmental stewardship and community support. The company maintains Forest Stewardship Council (FSC C013133) certification for its forestlands, manufacturing, and distribution operations.

Job Specific Information

Opportunity

Exciting opportunity to work as a Business Intern during Summer 2024 at our Ukiah, CA facility.

Our commitment to environmental responsibility extends to all areas of our business, from the forest to manufacturing operations and through to the distribution of lumber products to our customers.
Operational excellence is important to how we manage our businesses in a sustainable manner.

The Business Intern may be assigned to work in one or more of the following functional areas:
Accounting, Finance, IT
Sales and Marketing
Supply Chain and Procurement
Business Analytics
Human Resources
Housing and travel

Paid, shared company housing is available.
Travel costs paid by the company.

Opportunity to grow your career by working in your field of study and learning from experienced mentors.
Hands on work experience in a complex manufacturing and distribution environment.
Work cooperatively with employees, managers, and supervisors in different departments.
Possibility of full-time job placement after graduation.

GPA of 3.0 is required. Must be able to provide transcripts.

data.job_description:
Remote

PHARMACY BENEFITS MANAGEMENT PBM SME and BUSINESS ANALYST

Job Description:

We are looking to onboard a Senior Business Analyst in Manager role or Individual contributor depending on experience level. This person will have deep PBM domain expertise and who will help guide the roadmap and feature enhancements for the PBM product suite. This person will serve as a bridge between the Business users and/or Clinical end users (Pharmacists) and the Technical team (Developers and Testers primarily).

Minimum Qualifications:

EXPERIENCE LEVEL:
• Ideally 10+ years experience working in PBM domain (Claims processing related).
• Willing to consider less experienced candidates who can demonstrate depth in understanding PBM area.

PBM SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE:
• Candidate should have deep understanding of Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) business processes including Claims Adjudication, Data related processes (e.g. Eligibility data, Provider data, Drug data, Formulary data, Drug Utilization reviews) and their interconnections. Strong plus if candidate has experience with Electronic Prescriptions and Prior-Authorizations related standards.
• Deep understanding of related PBM standards from NCPDP. Strong plus if candidate also understands CMS regulations related to Medicare & state Medicaid Pharmacy programs.
• Candidate should have deep understanding of First Data Bank (FDB) Drug nomenclature and how to use FDB nomenclature in designing / configuring drug coverage (inclusions/exclusions/PA Criteria) or building Formulary / Preferred Drug Lists. In lieu of FDB, MEDISPAN data experience will be acceptable.
• Candidate should be well informed about current industry trends and evolving standards.
• College degree is preferred. Industry experience can be considered as substitute.
• Candidates who have strong Clinical background (e.g. Pharmacists) and some BA background are welcome to apply (provided they are willing to switch to being a full-fledged BA with inhouse training)

Non-Domain Expertise:
• Must understand Software Development Life Cycle - including requirements management.
• Must be able to capture requirements, document requirements and manage requirements using requirements management tools.
• Must be able to document business processes using a combination of tools - Visio, Powerpoint, Excel and Word formats depending on the context and synthesize requirements into user stories, decision tables or other pertinent formats
• Must have excellent communication and writing skills.
• Experience with SQL queries and understanding Data Models is a strong plus.
• Must be a team player willing to share knowledge and support team members from other areas e.g. Developers and QA Testers.

Job Responsibilities:
• Provide PBM Subject Matter Expertise for both (Development and Testing team) and non- stakeholders (e.g. Customers)
• Own responsibility for creating requirements specifications / design documents (e.g. wire-frames, decision tables) to help developers produce technical specifications.
• Own responsibility for configuring drug plan benefits (e.g. Covered drugs, Pricing configuration, PA requirements) using PBM system
• Interact with business and clinical users to elicit and understand business requirements, Translate the requirements into appropriate format for consumption by Development and Testing team.
• Good working knowledge on creating Process workflow or Use Cases, Powerpoint slides, Wireframes, Workflows using Microsoft Visio, Analyze data using Microsoft Excel is needed to be effective at Requirements management, Translating and simplifying requirements.

Document product features/requirements related documentation, prepare roadmaps (with aid of tools such as Visio, Power point)

data.job_title: IT Financial Project Analyst Co-op (Fall Session)
data.job_description:
Introduction
Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.

Overview

Get an insider view of the fast-changing grocery retail industry, while developing leadership skills and business knowledge to enhance your career.
This paid Co-op experience is an opportunity to contribute to help drive business results in an environment designed to promote and reward diversity, innovation and leadership.
• 6-month paid program.
• Work on impactful projects collaborating with grocery brands to develop innovative solutions.
• Leadership development seminars.
• Networking and professional engagement opportunities.
• One-on-one mentoring.
• Group community service event.
• Access to online career development tools and resources.
• Final project presentation to company leaders.
• Professional experience and industry exposure in partnership with the Great Local Brands of Ahold Delhaize USA.

Program Dates:

Spring: No longer available for this role

Fall: June 24th-December 6, 2024

Available Locations (Hybrid):

Quincy, MA; Salisbury, NC; Scarborough, ME or Carlisle, PA

Position Overview:

The Office of the CIO function within RBS IT houses several enabling cross functional capabilities leveraged by the broader IT organization including Strategy, Governance, Planning, Transformation Management, Portfolio Management, Project Management and Vendor Management.
The Financial Analysis and Reporting Analyst Co-op role will support the Director of Portfolio Budgets on various financial projects including the documenting of financial guidelines, business case creation, and the creation of training materials and videos.

Responsibilities
• Audit current financial processes to determine gaps in documentation, communication strategy, and processes.
• Conduct financial analysis to support business decisions, including forecasting, budgeting, variance analysis, and scenario planning.
• Develop financial models and perform sensitivity analysis to evaluate business initiatives, including ROI and NPV analysis.
• Partner with technology teams to monitor financial performance and identify opportunities for cost optimization and process improvement.
• Lead project management efforts for technology initiatives, including project planning, risk management, and stakeholder engagement.
• Monitor project progress and identify risks and issues, providing recommendations and escalating as needed.
• Develop and deliver project status reports, presentations, and other project-related communications to IT stakeholders.
• Collaborate with cross-functional technology teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
• Develop and maintain financial dashboards, reports, and metrics to track performance and identify trends.
• Maintain and report on overall initiatives roadmap.
• Track various initiatives status, associated financials and work with other PMO teams for periodic updates.
• Support creation of various leadership meeting materials as required.

Requirements
• Data analysis and reporting.
• Knowledge of GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles), standards, and regulations.
• Advanced skills in MS Excel, MS Power BI.
• Analyze large sets of data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
• Demonstrated ability to handle a wide variety of tasks, and change.
• Microsoft PowerPoint.
• Oral and/or written communication skills.
• Presentation skills.
• Strong analytical skills.
• Initiative.
• Attention to detail.
• Strategic planning.
• Highly organized.

Education:

Must be enrolled in a BS/BA, MS, or PhD program or a recent graduate in related field.

data.job_title: McKinsey Internship Summer Program for High School Students
data.job_description:
Are you a high school student with a passion for acquiring valuable expertise? Do you actually want to make a positive impact in the consulting industry? If so, look no further than the prestigious McKinsey Internship program. The intern jobs here will allow you to immerse yourself in real-world projects while working alongside experienced professionals. This company offers internships in summer, spring, and winter, providing a platform for talented individuals to explore various roles such as Data Science, Associate, and Business Analyst Intern. McKinsey welcomes freshmen who demonstrate exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as a strong drive to learn and grow. So, apply today!

For More Consulting Services Internships: Click Here

McKinsey Internship 2024 | Latest Opportunities for Undergraduates

About McKinsey

McKinsey & Company is a renowned global management consulting firm. This firm has established a noteworthy standing as a dependable advisor for commercial enterprises, governmental bodies, and nonprofit institutions across a wide range of industries. The mission of the company is to assist clients in addressing their most intricate challenges and attaining long-lasting growth. McKinsey is also known for its analytical and data-driven approach, offering strategic insights and innovative solutions to drive organizational performance. The company continues to shape the business landscape through its expertise, thought leadership, and commitment to delivering impactful results for its clients.

Eligibility Criteria:

The McKinsey and Company Internship program sets high standards for candidates, looking for individuals who demonstrate exceptional skills and abilities. Successful applicants often have a proven track record of academic excellence, with outstanding performance in their studies. McKinsey values diversity and seeks candidates from various educational backgrounds, including business, engineering, mathematics, and the sciences. The program’s recruiting timeline typically includes multiple rounds of interviews, case studies, and assessments in order to assess the candidates’ suitability for the role.

Also, Check Out: BCG Internship 2024 for Undergraduates | Application Process

Often Available Programs:
• Sophomore Summer Business Analyst
• Healthcare Consulting
• Digital
• Legal
• Off Cycle
• Diversity Program
• Sustainability
• Design
• Virtual
• Marketing
• HR

For Current Available Programs Internship Section

McKinsey Internship Interview Questions:

During the internship interview process, candidates can expect a dynamic and engaging experience. Interviewers will ask questions designed to assess problem-solving abilities, strategic thinking, and leadership potential. They may pose real-life business scenarios to evaluate analytical skills and the ability to work collaboratively. Additionally, candidates may be asked about their motivations for pursuing consulting, their understanding of McKinsey’s values, and their potential contributions to the firm. While salary specifics will vary, these programs offer competitive compensation packages, reflecting the value placed on the interns’ talent and dedication. Prepare to showcase your skills, enthusiasm, and unique perspectives during the process.

How to apply for McKinsey Internship?

Applying for a McKinsey Internship begins by clicking “Apply Here” and thoroughly researching the available programs on its official website. Once there, be sure to pay close attention to the specific requirements and deadline of the position you choose. Next, fill out an online form and prepare a captivating application package, including an impressive resume and a personalized cover letter that highlights your unique skills and experiences. Be sure to customize your application to demonstrate your passion for McKinsey and your alignment with its values. Finally, submit it through the online career portal, and stay proactive by following up with HR.

Last Date to Apply:

The application deadline to apply for an internship here may vary depending on the specific program.

data.job_description: Union Tank Car Company Come join a team where People make the difference! As a part of Marmon Holdings, Inc., a highly decentralized organization, we rely heavily on people with the aptitude, attitude, and entrepreneurial spirit to drive our success, and we're committed to attracting and retaining top talent. Marmon Holdings, Inc., a Berkshire Hathaway company, is significantly investing in attracting, retaining, and developing the deep and diverse talent pool needed to support our more than 100 operating companies across the globe. Union Tank Car – Leasing Business Unit Summary of Responsibilities: The Business Analyst Intern will work with the Business Analytics Department team on a variety of specific projects and areas as noted below. This position will report directly to the Manager, Business Analytics, but will have exposure to the wider business teams. Interns will complete a capstone type project over the summer culminating in a presentation to business leadership. Key Projects: Participate in team meetings Company repairs spending analysis Assisting with various monthly revenue and cost reporting Competitor benchmarking Compiling monthly market intelligence reports Updating/revising tank car market overview presentation Required Education and Experience: Pursuing an undergraduate (or Graduate) degree in Business, Finance, Marketing, or related field Rising junior or senior Strong interest in applying business knowledge to practical problems Ability to comply with deadlines Problem solving and critical thinking skills Excellent organizational skills Interest in technology and process improvement Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint No previous work experience required Certain peak periods may provide opportunity for overtime. This is a paid position. The internship will run for 12 weeks from May to August. Exact dates flexible based on school schedules. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying. #LI-DNI Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates will be required to complete additional job-related screening processes as permitted or required by applicable law. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying. With more than 100 autonomous manufacturing and service businesses, Marmon Holdings, Inc. may be the biggest company you’ve never heard of. Part of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., Marmon is a global industrial organization comprising 11 diverse groups with 20,000-plus employees and $10 billion in annual revenue. As leaders in every industry we serve, Marmon companies have earned a great degree of independence. And our people thrive on an entrepreneurial spirit. At the same time, our group structure gives every Marmon company access to the expertise of other Marmon companies serving the same or related markets and customers – all with the support of the entire Marmon organization. Working together, we become something more than the sum of our parts. We become the most reliable solution provider for a broad range of industries and customers worldwide. In every case, Marmon’s success is due to our people. People with talent, drive and high ethical standards. People who are following their passions and building their careers across Marmon. Want to learn and perfect your craft? Want to sharpen your skills while helping to solve challenges for our customers and our world? Looking for a chance to grow within – or perhaps outside – your field? Find a Marmon company that matches your passion. And see what you can do with the support of a team that values your contribution. Valerie Hebenstreit - University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, 2020;2022: "As an intern at Marmon, I had the opportunity to work with several incredibly knowledgeable business leaders. Marmon offers a unique experience, one that has allowed me to grow my skills exponentially in one summer and now as a full-time employee." Hayley Bernson - University of Illinois Chicago, 2019: "My internship at Marmon was a rewarding experience. Having been provided with the opportunity to gain experience and knowledge surrounded by business professionals and leaders has helped me flourish into the tax professional I am today." Sophia DiFatta - University of Iowa, 2018: "As an intern at Marmon, I had the opportunity to apply the skills I was learning in school. Since then, I've been able to continue learning through experiences across many industries and job functions." Rosevette Toussaint - University of Central Florida, 2021: "When I began the internship, I knew continuing a career with Marmon would be the right decision. data.job_description:
Why We Need You
Smith Publicity partners with authors, experts, publishers, companies and organizations to plan and execute targeted media strategies in order to build visibility for their projects. Through our 23 years of experience, we secure media coverage—with television, magazine, newspaper, podcasts, online/digital, radio, and blog outlets—in order to help our clients reach their goals of building discoverability and awareness for their expert platform, author brand, books, or awareness about their company and its offerings. We play a creative, highly personal, fast paced and rewarding role with our clients.

Smith Publicity is a well-respected and well-known leader in the publishing and publicity industries. We have grown every year in the company’s history and are excited to find our next team member.

The Business Development Coordinator creates the first impression of the Smith Publicity brand with potential new clients, and plays an important foundational role to support the business development team to drive new business. Clients include New York Times bestselling authors, new independently published authors, CEOs and business experts and subject matter authorities worldwide, publishing industry professionals, and publishers looking for promotional support for their projects.

You will work independently and as part of the business development team to vet prospective author and publisher projects via phone and e-mail, input and maintain accurate campaign details in our CRM, Salesforce, draft client agreements, and provide administrative support to the business development team.

Additional initiatives include creating or revising existing marketing material, proposal templates, creating or revising internal support documents for the business development team, and running key reports. Support to the marketing and administrative team will also be required.

Who We Are Looking For
• Sense of Urgency: Day to day, you know how to prioritize, show energy and react to opportunities. You’re able to instill a sense of urgency in others and meet deadlines. You are organized, detailed oriented, able to multitask, and possess computer/research skills— and take ownership for your responsibilities.
• Positive and Caring Attitude: You are positive, patient, and present a professional attitude toward prospective clients throughout the vetting process. Promoting books is a highly personal endeavor, and each client needs to be treated with care.
• Strong Communicator: You can craft clear, concise written communication tailored to specific objectives. Speak with potential clients to relate baseline information and take detailed and specific information to relay with the business development team. Familiar with Salesforce or CRM a plus.
• Curious Learner: You are news and media savvy, following trends and breaking stories across print, broadcast and online media. Follow trends and breaking stories in the publishing world. You ask questions because you have a genuine interest in learning more about the industry and our work with clients.
• Kind, humble, and fun: We want you to be a person we enjoy collaborating with, spending time with, and investing in as these qualities are people who become great colleagues and teammates. We work very hard, and support each other and our clients along the way with kindness and humor.
• Be Available (Eventually) On Site. Right now, we are working remotely and the position will likely start remotely, but when we are back in the office, you will be based in our Cherry Hill, NJ headquarters.

What You'll Be Doing
• Responding promptly to prospect author and publisher inquiries via phone and e-mail
• Conducting initial phone vetting to determine project details and facilitate assignment to appropriate business development associate
• Directing any leads deemed unqualified to other sources for assistance
• Working with business development team to evaluate incoming potential projects
• Tracking details of business development prospects from lead to active opportunity status in Salesforce during proposal stage
• Drafting agreements and invoice requests in support of the business development team
• Inputting campaign information, including accurate schedules, in Salesforce
• Running reports to ensure leads are responded to by the assigned business development associate in a timely manner
• Assisting with coordinating company trade show presence, including outreach to authors, publishers and industry experts, setting up appointments, and organizing materials. May have opportunity for on site trade show presence.
• Working closely and collaboratively with the administrative team to bridge the gap between business development and administration efforts
• Supporting the business development, marketing and administration teams with various projects on an as-needed basis
• Other duties as assigned

Requirements:
• Minimum 1 to 2 years of communications, marketing, sales, publishing, publicity or related business experience
• College degree or similar work experience

Smith Publicity is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: From $30.00 per day

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:
• Cherry Hill, NJ 08003: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Cherry Hill, NJ 08003

About the Job

GigHire™ Combining the latest AI technology with today's job seeker mentality our app is changing the landscape for both hiring managers (GigBosses) and Medical Residents (GigDocs).

www.GigHire.io

We are the most secure and easy to use app on the market. Feel confident your information, data and payments are secure from any fraud. Our AI proprietary software matches you with the best candidates and matches you with the best jobs.

We are creating a culture here at GigHire ™. Our product is built for the job seeker in mind. Our Career Path helps our GigDocs with cutting edge technology and features such as: Swipe right swipe left job search, in app interviews via zoom, GigResume writer, GigCover Letter writer, and a selfcare section to make sure our GigDocs our grounded.

Responsibilities As an Investor Development Internship you will be responsible for executing social media strategies through LinkedIn and emails into Venture Capital, Private Equity and Angel Investors targets to identify key stakeholders and push them into a meeting with our Founder for a pitch deck meeting.

NOTE: This is a nonpaying internship for experience build out.

Your day will include:

1. Outbound activities (primarily calls, LinkedIn messages and emails) to drive zoom meetings with investors.

2. Identifying key stakeholders at target facilities and developing plans to connect and sell to them.

3. Conducting effective research on the targets to identify backgrounds on the investors and the key decision makers along with their history of investments.

4. Recording next steps in our CRM system for tracking

You:

· Student or entry level experience building. Non-paying 3-Month Internship.

· Must be comfortable talking on the phone.

· Social selling through LinkedIn is a must.

· A self-starting, entrepreneurial spirit.

· A strong verbal communicator.

· A willingness to learn, improve, and think outside the box.

· An interest in technology and startups.

· Must have reliable internet, a phone, and laptop.

Why should you apply?

· Ground floor experience with an AI tech start up

· Rapport building with team. If we see your drive as an intern and see your success you will have a permanent place once we are funded.

· Start up mode so ground floor means you have a voice and upward mobility is fast!

· We’re fully remote. Flexible times for you.

· You’ll experience the fast pace of a high-growth tech startup.

· Consistent feedback and coaching will be provided. We intend to teach you fundamental skills that will carry you through this job and the rest of your career.

Social selling through LinkedIn is a must

A strong verbal communicator
A willingness to learn, improve, and think outside the box
